title: What do the symbols d dx and dy dx mean? - Quora

response.answer_text: d/dx is an operator. It works on a given relation to produce, as its output, the derivative of the relation at the x-coordinate value = x. Just like, as an example, square is an operator that works on a number and returns a value of that number multiplied by itself. dy/dx simply means that the d/dx operator is working on y, which is supposed to depend on x.
